titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Samuel B. Bassett Papers

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections, University of Washington Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Mark Carlson via XSLT stylesheet conversion from Millennium MARC records 2007
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS ( Describing Archives: A Content Standard).

repository.corpname: University of Washington Libraries Special Collections

did.abstract: Legal case files of a lawyer in Seattle, Washington

bioghist.p: Bassett was a Seattle plaintiffs lawyer who practiced with George Vandeveer from 1924-1942 and represented the Joint Council of Teamsters, No. 28 and various Teamster locals.

scopecontent.p: Legal case files (bulk), 1926/27, ca. 1948-1965; incoming letters, 1953, 1963.

Accession includes a sample of legal records showing early and distinctive cases, including a wire tapping case, an Indian fishing rights case, a case involving dismissal of a University of Washington basketball coach, and cases involving Seattle labor unions and labor leaders, including Frank Brewster.

accessrestrict.p: Access restricted: For terms of access, contact Special Collections for details.

userestrict.p: Creator's literary rights not transferred to the University of Washington Libraries.

otherfindaid.p: The visual materials that form part of this collection are described and indexed in A Guide to the .
Inventory/container list available in Special Collections.
